topic.title: torrentfreak: U.S. GOVT: EXCESSIVE PIRACY PUNISHMENTS SHOULD BE AVOIDED
topic.body:
The U.S. Department of Commerceâ€™s Internet Policy Task Force has released a set of copyright reform proposals. The Government recommends Congress to implement various changes to avoid excessive damages awards and stresses that copyright trolling should not be tolerated.

https://torrentfreak.com/u-s-govt-excessive-piracy-punishments-should-be-avoided-160129/?utm_source=feedburner&utm_medium=feed&utm_campaign=Feed%3A+Torrentfreak+%28Torrentfreak%29

6_1MmPY9fniJwwhP6WsgH4jWoq5rBAVV6KWy.body:
What can I say about this... things are not always that easy. Take this example:

Once upon a time a couple of torrent programmers decided that it is important to have a p2p chat system between torrent peers. They took pascal and wrote free peer to peer software called 'sky p2p' or better known at that time as 'skyper'. But they couldn't register doman skyper.com because someone already had it, so they shorthen domain to skype. For a while it was great, it worked and was fun, but had a problem that people would have same name and no way of reserving it - there was no central server for the authentication...

... cut a long story short...over some long time... & lot of money exchanging hands...& passing ownership over code...

These days Microsoft makes 'Skype for business' to replace Lync as instant messenger in enterprise environment.

Where the idea started, where it ended up?
